author: @kwtx
title: Classroom Champions: Reicher's TJ Bradley
text:
Classroom Champions: Reicher’s TJ Bradley
WACO, Texas (KWTX) - Bishop Reicher’s TJ Bradley is a true multi-sport athlete.
Over the course of his athletic career, he’s been named All-District in football and baseball, and basketball. He was also selected to the All-State basketball team and even set the Reicher school record for points scored.
When I play sports, I kind of get to think and be strategic about it,” said Bradley. “You got to pick up on your opponent’s weaknesses, what they’re good at and try to outplay them. I think that’s something I’ve always been drawn towards.”
That drive and competitiveness carries over to the classroom, though, it hasn’t always been a breeze.
TJ is dyslexic, yet, he carries a 4.45 GPA. He says staying active has helped him the most.
“I like being active, it goes hand in hand with my learning style,” said Bradley. “I’m very much an active learner and I like to be doing things. I have to fidget and I have to be moving.”
TJ is on track to graduate as class salutatorian. He’s looking forward to studying engineering at his dream school down in College Station.
“I’ve always wanted to, since I was probably like five, go to A&M,” said Bradley. “Knowing that in high school, A&M’s automatic acceptance is top 10 percent. I know it’s a difficult school to get into. If I do well in school, I get to go to A&M and I get to follow in the lineage of my parents.”
Before he heads off to Texas A&M, TJ says he’s most focused on growing in his faith. It’s the most important part of his life.
“I’ve noticed that I’ve grown deeper in love,” said Bradley. “When things go wrong, I can kind of just be like, ‘Hey Jesus, this is how I’m feeling, I don’t really understand why things are like this, I’m kind of stressed out. I need your help to calm down and focus on you and put what is stressing me behind.”
Congratulations to TJ Bradley, you’re a Classroom Champion!
Copyright 2025 KWTX. All rights reserved.

author: @mskagency
title: Полиция задержала мужчину за кражу кошелька с 310 тыс. руб. в Подмосковье | Accidents | Seldon News
text: В Богородском городском округе полицейские задержали подозреваемого в краже кошелька. Об этом сообщила пресс-служба Главного управления МВД России по Московской области. «В дежурную часть МУ МВД России «Ногинское» с заявлением о краже кошелька с денежными средствами обратился житель Электростали. Сумма материального ущерба составила 310 тыс. руб. Потерпевший пояснил, что потерял кошелек в терминале одной из транспортных компаний Ногинска. В результате проведения оперативно-разыскных мероприятий сотрудниками второго отдела полиции МУ МВД России «Ногинское» по подозрению в совершении... Copyright information of photo and video materials was taken from the website «Agency of city news "Moscow"» , more details in our Terms of Service
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->robbery and theft

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Thank you Lake Oswego and West Linn!
text:
By This article was brought to you by Lake Grove Dental, Lake Oswego Review Expert. Sponsored Content ,
1 hour ago
Being voted the best dentist in town is an esteemed recognition accompanied by significant responsibilities. It symbolizes not only professional competence but also a commitment to exemplary patient care and satisfaction. This accolade carries more weight than mere acknowledgment; it signifies a mandate to maintain the highest standards of dentistry and ethical conduct.First and foremost, being bestowed with the title dentist means we assume the responsibility for the oral health of our community. Patients entrust their well-being to us, expecting expert guidance, compassionate care, and effective treatments; all in an office using the most contemporary equipment and materials. We must continually enhance expertise through ongoing education, staying abreast of the latest advancements in dentistry.We began as a small three operatory office in the First Addition; fostering trust and cultivating strong patient relationships has been the backbone of Lake Grove Dental since 1960. Attentive listening, clear communication of procedures, and involving patients in treatment decisions are paramount to establishing a supportive and comfortable environment.Using a conservative approach to restorative care and doing biomimetic dentistry (replicating the strength, function, and esthetics of natural teeth by replacing only damaged, decayed, and broken tooth structure whenever possible) is Dr. Branen’s mantra. Understanding the connection of oral health to total health, and helping our patients understand that too, is also an important part of what we do.We thank all who voted for us and will strive to always hit the high bar for our community.

author: , York Dispatch
title: York County residents may have to deal heat and rain over next couple of days
text: York County residents may have to deal heat and rain over next couple of days A heat advisory for York and surrounding counties remains in effect until 8 p.m. Friday but keep an eye on the sky for thunderstorms over the next couple of days. While the heat advisory ends Friday night, heat index readings could be as high as 100 degrees on Saturday. In addition to the heat impacts, thunderstorms could produce localized flooding and strong winds. Scattered strong thunderstorms accompanied by potentially damaging wind gusts and localized flooding could impact the area Saturday afternoon. There is a 70% chance of rain on Friday with new rainfall amounts between a tenth and a quarter of an inch. Otherwise, it will be partly sunny with a high near 91 and a heat index value of 101. MORE: [Trump claims US 'a dumping ground' at Harrisburg rally, first in Pa. since shooting](https://www.yorkdispatch.com/story/news/local/2024/08/01/trump-claims-us-a-dumping-ground-at-harrisburg-rally-first-in-pa-since-shooting/74634336007/) MORE: [79-year-old man dies after being struck by vehicle while walking in Springettsbury Twp.](https://www.yorkdispatch.com/story/news/local/2024/07/31/79-year-old-man-dies-after-being-struck-by-vehicle-while-walking-in-springettsbury-twp/74625090007/) MORE: [2024 York State Fair saw boost in attendance over last year, organizers say](https://www.yorkdispatch.com/story/news/local/2024/08/01/2024-york-state-fair-saw-boost-in-attendance-over-last-year-organizers-say/74618999007/) There is a 60% chance of rain Friday night. Otherwise, it will be mostly cloudy with a low around 73. Saturday, there is a 90% chance of rain, with new rainfall amounts between a quarter and a half an inch possible. Otherwise, the high will be near 91 degrees with a heat index value near 100. Rain chances remain high Saturday night with an 80% chance of showers. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and a quarter inch are possible. The low temperature will be near 72 degrees. [>> Please consider subscribing to support local journalism. ](https://cm.yorkdispatch.com/specialoffer/) Rain chances continue Sunday and after a break Monday, return Tuesday and Wednesday. Here is the outlook: Sunday: There is a 50% chance of showers and thunderstorms after 8 a.m. Otherwise, it will be partly sunny, with a high near 88. Sunday Night: There is a 30% chance of thunderstorms before 8 p.m. Otherwise, it will be partly cloudy, with a low of around 70. Monday: It will be sunny and hot, with a high near 93. Monday Night: It will be partly cloudy, with a low of around 70. Tuesday: There is a 30% chance of showers and thunderstorms after 2 p.m. Otherwise, it will be mostly sunny, with a high near 90. Tuesday Night: There is a 40% chance of showers and thunderstorms. Otherwise, it will be partly cloudy, with a low around 69. Wednesday: There is a 40% chance of showers and thunderstorms. Otherwise, it will be partly sunny, with a high near 85. Wednesday Night: There is a 30% chance of showers and thunderstorms. Otherwise, it will be partly cloudy, with a low around 65.

author: R7.com
title: Pacientes de clínica odontológica protestam por serviços não recebidos
text:
Pacientes de clínica odontológica protestam por serviços não recebidos
Local foi acusado de não entregar tratamentos pagos
Balanço Geral Goiás|Do R7
Uma escola de implantes dentários, interditada pelo Procon no ano passado, voltou a funcionar em Goiânia (GO), gerando protestos de pacientes.
Eles acusam o estabelecimento de não entregar os tratamentos odontológicos pagos. A clínica, que estava proibida de firmar novos contratos, deveria apenas concluir os serviços em andamento. No entanto, os clientes denunciam que o tratamento foi mal executado ou nem sequer iniciado.
O Procon agora aguarda uma avaliação jurídica para determinar as próximas medidas.

author: Mindy Weisberger
title: Foxes were once humans’ best friends, study says
text:
Sign up for CNN’s Wonder Theory science newsletter. Explore the universe with news on fascinating discoveries, scientific advancements and more .
CNN — In an ancient grave in what’s now northwestern Argentina, a person was buried with a canine companion — but this animal friend wasn’t a dog, according to new research. The burial held the skeleton of a type of canid that may have once competed with dogs for human affection: a fox.
Humans and dogs have a long history. The relationship between the two species is tens of thousands of years old. However, a fresh analysis of evidence from a Patagonian burial dating back about 1,500 years hints at a similar close connection between a hunter-gatherer in southern South America and the large extinct fox species Dusicyon avus.
A new study shows that dogs migrated with humans from East Asia through the Bering Land Bridge to the Americas. Ettore Mazza Related article Dogs likely migrated to the Americas with humans over 15,000 years ago, study says
Archaeologists originally uncovered the near-complete D. avus skeleton buried alongside a human at Cañada Seca, a site in northern Patagonia, in 1991. There were no cut marks on the bones, so the fox hadn’t been eaten, said Dr. Ophélie Lebrasseur , a researcher with the Wellcome Trust Palaeogenomics and Bio-Archaeology Research Network at the University of Oxford’s School of Archaeology in the United Kingdom.
An in-depth analysis of ancient DNA and radiocarbon dating confirmed the fox’s species and age, and examination of collagen in the fox’s remains revealed that it ate the same food that this group of humans did. Along with the skeleton’s placement in the grave, the animal’s diet suggested that the fox was tame and may have been kept as a pet, scientists reported Wednesday in the journal Royal Society Open Science .
The discovery adds to a growing body of evidence from burial sites on other continents indicating that individual foxes were tamed by humans and shared a connection based on companionship.
The fox and hunter-gatherer society D. avus lived from the Pleistocene Epoch (around 2.6 million to 11,700 years ago) into the Holocene, becoming extinct about 500 years ago. It was roughly the size of a modern German shepherd but far less bulky, weighing up to 33 pounds (15 kilograms).
Parts of the D. avus specimen were buried alongside a human at Cañada Seca, a site in northern Patagonia. Courtesy Francisco Prevosti “In general, Dusicyon avus has a carnivorous kind of diet,” said Lebrasseur, who co-led the study with Dr. Cinthia Abbona , a researcher with Argentina’s National Scientific and Technical Research Council. But when the scientists tested the fox skeleton from the burial, they found that its diet was less carnivorous than expected, and more similar to the diets of humans.
“That suggests either the community was feeding it, or it was around the community and feeding on the kitchen refuse,” Lebrasseur told CNN. “It would suggest that there’s a closer relationship and integration of the canid within the society.”
The notion of foxes as pets in South America aligns with evidence from other fox burials in Europe and Asia, said Dr. Aurora Grandal-d’Anglade , a paleobiologist at the Universidade da Coruña in Spain. Grandal-d’Anglade, who was not involved in the new study, previously described Bronze Age graves in the Iberian Peninsula that included dozens of dogs and four foxes buried alongside people. Researchers found that the foxes had been arranged much like the dogs were, suggesting that they, too, were companions for humans.
Overview of the archaeological excavations in Malomirovo, Bulgaria Michał Podsiadło Related article Skeletons buried on the Eurasian steppe reveal the earliest known horse riders
“There is no reason why foxes could not be domesticated,” Grandal-d’Anglade told CNN in an email. “We know that humans in many completely different societies often keep domestic animals (not only canids, but e.g. monkeys, birds, reptiles) simply as companion animals. When viewed in this light, more and more sites appear where foxes seem to have played the role of pet animals.”
Finding D. avus in a human grave was surprising for another reason — while the species was once widespread across southern South America, it was previously unknown in this part of Patagonia. Hunter-gatherers who lived in the region typically stayed within a range of about 44 miles (70 kilometers), so they likely encountered the friendly fox within that range, according to the study.
“The Dusicyon avus must have been part of the nearby vicinity, to be able to be integrated within the community,” Lebrasseur said.
What fox burials reveal about ‘man’s best friend’ The analysis also shed light on what drove the foxes to extinction — or rather, what didn’t. One hypothesis suggested that the foxes interbred with dogs that European colonizers introduced to South America, and that interbreeding eventually caused the foxes’ lineage to peter out. But the fox’s DNA told a different story, the study authors reported.
“Based on what we were able to recover and the technique that we developed at Oxford a few years ago, we were able to suggest that the hybridization between domestic dogs and Dusicyon avus would not have been able to produce fertile offspring,” Lebrasseur said.
D. avus lived from the Pleistocene Epoch (around 2.6 million to 11,700 years ago) into the Holocene, becoming extinct about 500 years ago. Here is a complete skull from a different site than the one in northern Patagonia. Courtesy Francisco Prevosti However, it’s still possible that dogs weren’t entirely innocent in the foxes’ decline. With a similar diet to D. avus, dogs may have helped speed the foxes’ extinction by outcompeting them. Dogs could also have carried and transmitted diseases that sickened the foxes, Lebrasseur added.
Shutterstock Related article At least five types of dog existed by the end of the Ice Age, 11,000 years ago
Experts often explain dog domestication as something that happened because humans realized that they could put dogs to work as hunters or herders, Grandal-d’Anglade said. But the D. avus skeleton at Cañada Seca and other fox burials hint that an animal didn’t need to be a useful worker to be nurtured by humans — it could simply be a friend.
“The proliferation of canids of different species in close relationship with humans seems to indicate that in principle it was a relationship of affection, of companionship,” Grandal-d’Anglade said. “The fact that we find them in so many different societies and on different continents indicates that keeping animals for companionship, and not only as working or meat animals, is an ancestral trait in humans.”
Mindy Weisberger is a science writer and media producer whose work has appeared in Live Science, Scientific American and How It Works magazine.

author: editor@martinoticias.com (Redacción Martí Noticias)
title: Dos sistemas de baja presión en el Caribe amenazan a Cuba
text:
El Centro Nacional de Huracanes de Estados Unidos alertó este viernes sobre las probabilidades de que se desarrolle una amplia área de baja presión sobre el Mar Caribe suroeste en las próximas horas y otra al este de Puerto Rico, que pudieran afectar a Cuba.
La localizada en el suroeste del Mar Caribe tiene una probabilidad del 30% de convertirse en ciclón en las próximas 48 horas, indicaron los expertos.
"Es probable que se forme una depresión tropical a finales de este fin de semana o principios de la próxima semana mientras el sistema se desplaza generalmente hacia el norte o hacia el noroeste sobre el Mar Caribe central u occidental", indica el pronóstico sobre la extensa área de mal tiempo cerca de las costas de Costa Rica y Nicaragua.
En su avance hacia el norte, se acercará sobre la costa sur de Cuba, en un trayecto en el que pudiera convertirse en una depresión tropical, una tormenta tropical o un sistema menos organizado.
Independientemente del desarrollo, son posibles lluvias localmente fuertes sobre porciones de las áreas terrestres adyacentes del Caribe occidental.
Por otra parte, el sistema de baja presión localizado cerca de Puerto Rico está produciendo una gran área de aguaceros y tormentas eléctricas sobre porciones de las Antillas Mayores y las aguas adyacentes del Atlántico y el noreste del Caribe.
Es posible un desarrollo lento de este sistema durante los próximos días a medida que se mueve hacia el oeste-noroeste. Después de ese tiempo, se espera que este sistema se absorba en el área de baja presión sobre el Caribe.
Esta depresión puede provocar posibles lluvias localmente fuertes durante los próximos días a través de Puerto Rico y la Española hasta el este de Cuba y el sureste de Bahamas.

author: @Live_Hindustan
title: एक जुलाई को निकलेगी न्याय यात्रा, इंटर की पढ़ाई बंद करने के विरोध में छात्र लामबंद
text:
Hindi News
Jharkhand News
Jamshedpur NewsMass Student Protest Against Closure of Intermediate Studies in Jamshedpur Colleges
एक जुलाई को निकलेगी न्याय यात्रा, इंटर की पढ़ाई बंद करने के विरोध में छात्र लामबंद
कोल्हान छात्र संघर्ष समिति ने नई शिक्षा नीति के तहत महाविद्यालयों में इंटरमीडिएट की पढ़ाई बंद करने के खिलाफ आंदोलन का एलान किया है। 1 जुलाई 2025 को छात्र 'न्याय यात्रा' निकालेंगे। छात्रों का कहना है...
Newswrap
हिन्दुस्तान, जमशेदपुरThu, 26 June 2025 12:15 PM
जमशेदपुर।कोल्हान छात्र संघर्ष समिति ने नई शिक्षा नीति के तहत महाविद्यालयों में इंटरमीडिएट की पढ़ाई बंद किए जाने के खिलाफ बड़ा आंदोलन छेड़ने का एलान किया है। समिति ने मंगलवार को आयोजित प्रेस वार्ता में घोषणा की कि आगामी 1 जुलाई 2025 को जिलेभर के कॉलेजों के छात्र-छात्राएं "न्याय यात्रा" निकालेंगे, जिसमें हजारों की संख्या में छात्र शामिल होंगे।प्रेस वार्ता में छात्र नेताओं ने कहा कि इंटर की पढ़ाई बंद होने से न केवल छात्रों की शिक्षा बाधित हो रही है, बल्कि दूर-दराज से आए छात्रों को हॉस्टल छोड़ने की भी नौबत आ गई है। इससे गरीब, आदिवासी और मजदूर वर्ग के छात्रों की पढ़ाई पर गंभीर असर पड़ रहा है।टाटा
कॉलेज छात्र संघ के पूर्व सचिव पिपुन बारीक ने कहा कि इंटर बंद करने का फैसला छात्रों के भविष्य के साथ खिलवाड़ है। झामुमो छात्र मोर्चा अध्यक्ष सनातन पिंगुवा ने कहा कि यह शिक्षा के अधिकार का उल्लंघन है और यदि मांगें नहीं मानी गईं, तो आंदोलन और उग्र रूप लेगा।एनएसयूआई कोल्हान विश्वविद्यालय अध्यक्ष वीर सिंह बालमुचु ने नई शिक्षा नीति में पाई जा रही कमियों को लेकर कहा कि छात्रों को परेशान कर नई व्यवस्था थोपना गलत है।युवा कांग्रेस जिलाध्यक्ष प्रीतम बांकिरा ने चेतावनी दी कि यदि सरकार और राज्यपाल ने जल्द स्थायी समाधान नहीं निकाला, तो सभी कॉलेजों में तालाबंदी की जाएगी। वहीं, झामुमो युवा मोर्चा सचिव मंजीत हंसदा ने कहा कि छात्र यदि चाहेंगे तो आंदोलन को राजभवन तक ले जाया जाएगा।
